>The last thing I've got a question (probably best if Tom could answer
>this) - the information we were given has the Scenario Type as a character,
>and George said it was either a 0 or 1 in the files he checked - but 0 and 1
>don't actually represent characters, so shouldn't they be stored as bytes (I
>know the difference isn't much).

Sorry for that confusion -- it's a one-byte value, which has bit-flags (1, 
2, 4, etc.) to indicate ways the scenario can be solved.  Right now:
         * "0" means "must kill all enemies to complete level" .. which is 
the default.
         * Flag 1 - Characters can always exit the level
         * Flag 2 - Must kill all generators to exit the level
         * Flag 4 - Must save all NPCs to exit the level

Hope that helps!

--Tom
